chapters.content: Introduction to piping and tubing systems for industrial and commercial applications. Topics include valve locations, bonding requirements, CSST systems, commercial cooking appliances, and piping specifications for NPS and schedules.

assignment_questions.question: Which of the following valves is located between the main manual shut-off valve and the automatic valves in a commercial valve train?
What is the primary purpose of bonding metal gas piping systems?
options: c) To prevent dangerous voltage differences
assignment_questions.correct_answer: c) To prevent dangerous voltage differences

assignment_questions.question: Which CSA standard specifies bonding requirements for gas piping?
What type of tubing has specific bonding requirements due to lightning concerns?
What is the most common pipe schedule for gas piping?
What color is used to identify gas piping in commercial and industrial installations?
What does NPS stand for?
Which schedule has the thinnest wall thickness?
What requires periodic maintenance in lubricated plug valves?
Which Canadian code provides requirements for bonding and grounding?
Where should manual shut-off valves be located?

chapters.content: Welding safety and pipe preparation covers measuring techniques, pipe preparation, beveling at 37.5 degrees, maintaining proper root gap, tacking procedures, and radiographic testing requirements per ASME BPVC.

assignment_questions.question: What is the correct bevel angle for pipe welding preparation?
What is the correct root gap for pipe welding?
How many tack welds are typically used to position a pipe joint?
What is the purpose of the root gap?
options: b) To allow proper weld penetration
assignment_questions.correct_answer: b) To allow proper weld penetration

assignment_questions.question: What does fitting allowance represent?
options: a) The angle of the fitting
b) The cost of the fitting
c) The distance pipe enters the fitting
d) The pressure rating of the fitting
assignment_questions.correct_answer: c) The distance pipe enters the fitting

assignment_questions.question: Which testing method uses X-rays to check weld quality?
What code specifies requirements for radiographic testing?
Where should the first tack weld be placed?
What happens if the root gap is too large?
options: c) Wastes filler material and weakens joint
assignment_questions.correct_answer: c) Wastes filler material and weakens joint

assignment_questions.question: What shape does the bevel create when two pipes are joined?
End-to-centre measurements determine distance from pipe end to what?

b) To provide optimal weld penetration and strength
assignment_questions.correct_answer: b) To provide optimal weld penetration and strength

assignment_questions.question: Tack welds must be strong enough to hold the joint but small enough to what?
options: b) Be easily incorporated into the final weld
assignment_questions.correct_answer: b) Be easily incorporated into the final weld

assignment_questions.question: Which systems require radiographic testing of welds?
options: c) High-pressure systems or critical locations
assignment_questions.correct_answer: c) High-pressure systems or critical locations

chapters.content: Utility and non-utility piping covers underground piping identification, one-call services, CSST systems per CSA B149.1 clauses, as-built drawings, and tracing methods for existing piping systems.

assignment_questions.question: How many business days in advance must you call before digging?
What does CSST stand for?
Which CSA B149.1 clause covers bonding requirements for CSST?
What must you do when digging within 1 meter of marked utilities?
What do as-built drawings show?
options: c) Actual location of installed systems
assignment_questions.correct_answer: c) Actual location of installed systems

options: b) Tracing existing piping from appliance to source
assignment_questions.correct_answer: b) Tracing existing piping from appliance to source

When must as-built drawings be updated?
options: b) During installation to reflect changes

chapters.chapter_name: Pipe sizing for large piping systems
chapters.content: Pipe sizing for large piping systems covers the six-step procedure, calculated zones (CZ), length of equivalent run (LER), proving procedures, and two-stage system considerations for commercial and industrial applications.

assignment_questions.question: The reasons for having separate sizing tables for natural gas and propane fuels are because of the differing properties as gases.
Put the procedural steps of pipe sizing in correct order: (1) Sketch system (2) Select table (3) Determine CZ (4) Size sections (5) Prove CZ

chapters.chapter_name: Purging operations on large piping systems
chapters.content: Purging operations on large piping systems covers CSA B149.1 requirements, inert gas purging methods, slug purging techniques, use of pipeline inspection gauges (pigs), and maintaining proper purge velocity of 200 ft/min.

assignment_questions.question: With what would you purge a pipe sized NPS 8 in or over if it has been tested with air?
options: c) Hydrogen, oxygen, or a mixture of both

assignment_questions.question: What could occur if purging is not carried out correctly?
options: a) The wrong gas could enter the pipe
b) An accidental explosion from a gas-air mixture could occur inside or outside the pipe
c) A blockage in the pipe could go undetected
assignment_questions.correct_answer: b) An accidental explosion from a gas-air mixture could occur inside or outside the pipe

assignment_questions.question: It is acceptable to purge a new gas line through the burner system into a combustion chamber.
options: a) True (if the building is vacant)

assignment_questions.question: Before fuel gas is introduced into a pipe, the air is purged out of a larger diameter piping system with an inert gas so _______.
options: a) There will be no air in the pipe to support combustion
b) Mercaptan will not be washed out of the gas
c) The gas will ignite properly
assignment_questions.correct_answer: a) There will be no air in the pipe to support combustion

assignment_questions.question: Instead of completely purging long, large pipes with nitrogen, you can _______.
What is the normal purge velocity for large pipes?

chapters.content: Rigging and hoisting safety covers equipment inspection checklists for hooks and shackles, eye bolt and hoist ring installation, turnbuckles, spreader beams, rope safe working load calculations (N=20 for manila, N=60 for nylon/polyester), and pre-hoist operations including centre of gravity considerations.

assignment_questions.question: What is the purpose of a hook latch or mouse?
options: b) To secure the throat opening for added safety
c) To increase the load capacity
assignment_questions.correct_answer: b) To secure the throat opening for added safety

assignment_questions.question: What is the maximum throat opening increase allowed for hooks before removal from service?

b) 10% not to exceed ½ in
assignment_questions.correct_answer: a) 5% not to exceed ¼ in

assignment_questions.question: What is the maximum included angle between two sling legs when using shackles at rated capacity?
What percentage reduction in original dimension requires removal of a shackle from service?
Which type of eye bolt should be used with soft metal workpieces like aluminum?
What must be ensured when installing hoist rings?
options: a) Use spacers between bushing and surface
b) Partial thread engagement is acceptable
c) Full and flush contact between bushing and mating surface
assignment_questions.correct_answer: c) Full and flush contact between bushing and mating surface

assignment_questions.question: What is the value of N for manila rope in the safe working load calculation?
What is the value of N for nylon and polyester rope in the safe working load calculation?
How much does a knot reduce the working strength of a rope?
Where should slings be attached to ensure balance?
options: a) Below the centre of gravity
b) At the centre of gravity
c) Above the centre of gravity
assignment_questions.correct_answer: c) Above the centre of gravity

options: b) Pre-use inspection and route clearance check
c) No inspection if equipment was recently used
assignment_questions.correct_answer: b) Pre-use inspection and route clearance check

CSA Unit 10 Advanced Piping Systems - 100 Question Test
Questions
What is bonding in gas piping systems? A) Welding pipe sections together B) Permanent joining of metallic parts to form an electrically conductive path C) Testing pipe joints for leaks D) Installing pipe supports
What is the minimum allowable pressure drop for commercial/industrial gas piping systems? A) Lower than residential systems B) Same as residential systems C) Higher than residential systems D) Depends on appliance type only
According to CSA B149.1, what is the minimum depth for underground gas piping in general areas? A) 12 in (300 mm) B) 15 in (400 mm) C) 18 in (450 mm) D) 24 in (610 mm)
What is the minimum depth for underground gas piping under commercial driveways? A) 15 in (400 mm) B) 18 in (450 mm) C) 24 in (610 mm) D) 30 in (760 mm)
What type of test is performed before appliance installation? A) Final leak test B) First pressure test C) Soap test only D) Visual inspection only
How long must a final leak test be performed after appliance installation? A) 5 minutes B) 10 minutes C) 15 minutes D) 30 minutes
What is the maximum spacing for 1/2 inch horizontal gas piping supports? A) 4 ft (1.2 m) B) 6 ft (2 m) C) 8 ft (2.5 m) D) 10 ft (3 m)
When is an expansion loop required for rooftop piping? A) When piping exceeds 50 ft in length B) When piping exceeds 75 ft in length C) When piping exceeds 100 ft in length D) When piping exceeds 125 ft in length
What is the maximum interval for gas piping identification when using banding or labels? A) 15 ft (5 m) B) 20 ft (6 m) C) 25 ft (8 m) D) 30 ft (9 m)
Where must a readily accessible manual shut-off valve be installed for residential appliances? A) Within 25 ft of the appliance B) Within 40 ft of the appliance C) Within 50 ft of the appliance D) Within 75 ft of the appliance
What is the minimum bonding jumper size for copper conductors? A) No. 8 AWG B) No. 6 AWG C) No. 4 AWG D) No. 2 AWG
What certification is required for commercial cooking appliance connectors? A) ANSI Z21.69/CSA 6.16 or ANSI Z21.101/CSA 8.5 B) CSA 3.11 only C) ANSI Z21.15 only D) Any gas-approved connector
What is the critical point of pure acetylene at 70°F (21°C)? A) 15 psi (103 kPa) B) 20 psi (138 kPa) C) 25 psi (172 kPa) D) 28 psi (193 kPa)
What are the explosive limits for acetylene in air (lower and upper)? A) 2.5% - 81% B) 4% - 75% C) 5% - 85% D) 3% - 90%
What type of welding certification governs gas pipe welding in Canada? A) Red Seal Program B) Provincial Boiler and Pressure Vessels Act C) CSA W59 D) ANSI certification
What is the land or root face in welding preparation? A) The sharp edge of a bevel B) The flat portion of approximately 1/16-1/8 in at the bevel edge C) The entire beveled surface D) The back side of the pipe
What angle should pipe ends be beveled for butt welding? A) 30° B) 37-1/2° C) 45° D) 60°
What is CSST? A) Canadian Steel Safety Testing B) Corrugated Stainless Steel Tubing C) Carbon Steel Support Technology D) Certified System Safety Testing
What is the main advantage of CSST over traditional black iron piping? A) Higher pressure rating B) Better corrosion resistance C) Lightweight and flexible with fewer connections D) Lower material cost
Can CSST be connected directly to a gas meter? A) Yes, always B) Yes, with proper fittings C) No, direct connection is not permissible D) Only for residential applications
What are the three identification options for gas piping in commercial buildings? A) Red paint, red banding, or red labels B) Yellow paint, yellow banding, or gas labels C) Blue paint, blue banding, or blue labels D) Any bright color, banding, or labels
What is NPS in piping terminology? A) National Pipe Standard B) Nominal Pipe Size C) Natural Pipe Specification D) North American Pipe Size
What does "as built" drawings mean? A) Original construction blueprints B) Preliminary design drawings C) Final blueprints showing actual installation with revisions D) Manufacturer specifications
What is a Code zone in gas pipe sizing? A) Geographic area covered by the code B) Horizontal grouping of flow values according to longest measured run C) Safety zone around gas equipment D) Pressure testing area
What is the Length of Equivalent Run (LER)? A) Measured length only B) Equivalent length only C) Measured length plus equivalent length of fittings D) Maximum allowable pipe length
How much more heat value does propane carry compared to natural gas? A) 1.5 times B) 2 times C) 2.5 times D) 3 times
What is the first step in the general sizing procedure? A) Select a table B) Sketch the system C) Determine code zone D) Size pipe sections
For pressures over 2 psi, what must be proven in the sizing procedure? A) Pipe material is adequate B) System pressure is correct C) Length of equivalent run is smaller than code zone used D) All fittings are properly rated
What is purging in gas piping systems? A) Testing for leaks B) Cleaning the inside of pipes C) Replacing existing fluid with desired fluid D) Installing new piping
For piping NPS 4 or larger, what must be used before purging with gas? A) Air only B) Nitrogen only C) Carbon dioxide, nitrogen, or mixture of these D) Any inert gas
What is slug purging? A) Using heavy materials to clean pipes B) Injecting a mass of inert gas as a barrier between air and fuel gas C) Rapid purging technique D) Emergency purging procedure
What is the minimum purge velocity in large piping? A) 100 ft/min B) 150 ft/min C) 200 ft/min D) 250 ft/min
What does SWL stand for in rigging? A) Standard Working Load B) Safe Working Load C) Secure Working Limit D) Safety Weight Limit
What is the sling angle factor used for? A) Calculating pipe angles B) Determining required sling size when angle is less than 90° C) Setting crane boom angles D) Measuring load distribution
What is the minimum sling angle recommended for safety? A) 30° B) 45° C) 60° D) 75°
How often should wire rope slings be inspected? A) Weekly B) Monthly C) Daily before use and frequently during use D) Only when damage is suspected
What is a critical lift? A) Any lift over 1000 lbs B) Lifts requiring engineering input due to size, weight, or susceptibility to damage C) Emergency lifts only D) Lifts using multiple cranes
What is the D/d ratio in wire rope slings? A) Diameter of load divided by diameter of sling B) Depth divided by diameter C) Distance divided by diameter D) Diameter divided by depth
What should be done if a load tilts during a test lift? A) Continue lifting slowly B) Lower immediately and reposition rigging C) Add more slings D) Increase crane speed
What is the rule for calculating safe working load for manila rope? A) Convert to 8ths, square numerator, multiply by 10 B) Convert to 8ths, square numerator, multiply by 20 C) Convert to 8ths, square numerator, multiply by 30 D) Convert to 8ths, square numerator, multiply by 40
What is the maximum test pressure for piping with working pressure up to 2 psig? A) 10 psig (70 kPa) B) 15 psig (100 kPa) C) 25 psig (170 kPa) D) 50 psig (340 kPa)
What is the test duration for piping with working pressure over 2 but not over 5 psig and length over 200 ft? A) 15 minutes B) 60 minutes C) 120 minutes D) 180 minutes
Which pipe schedule is most commonly used for gas systems? A) Schedule 20 B) Schedule 40 C) Schedule 80 D) Schedule 160
What protection is required for rooftop steel piping? A) One coat of paint B) Two coats of quality rust-proof paint C) Galvanizing only D) No protection needed
Why should yellow jacket PVC coatings not be used on rooftop piping? A) They are too expensive B) They break down with UV exposure C) They are not yellow enough D) They attract birds
What is required when paving extends 25 ft or more from a building with underground piping? A) Deeper burial depth B) Stronger pipe material C) Vent pipe inspection point D) Warning signs
What is the minimum width for yellow banding on gas piping? A) 1/2 in (13 mm) B) 3/4 in (19 mm) C) 1 in (25 mm) D) 2 in (50 mm)
What is a test firing valve? A) A valve used only during testing B) A valve that allows testing of safeties without gas entering combustion chamber C) A temporary valve for construction D) A backup safety valve
Where is the test firing valve located on commercial valve trains? A) Upstream of all controls B) Downstream of all safety controls, close to burner C) At the gas meter D) At the main shut-off
What type of valve must a test firing valve be? A) Gate valve B) Globe valve C) 1/4 turn valve with handle D) Butterfly valve
What is equipotential bonding? A) Connecting all metal parts to ground B) State where conductive parts are at substantially equal electric potential C) Welding metal parts together D) Electrical testing procedure
What is the Canadian Electrical Code requirement for gas piping bonding? A) Optional for residential B) Required for continuous metal gas piping systems with electric power C) Only required for commercial buildings D) Only required for high-pressure systems
What is the minimum clearance required for commercial cooking appliances? A) 3 inches B) 4 inches C) 6 inches D) 12 inches
What is required when a gas connector is used with commercial cooking equipment on wheels? A) Stronger connector B) Noncombustible restraining device C) Flexible hose only D) Rigid connection
What joining method is primarily used for large underground gas piping? A) Threading B) Welding C) Flanging D) Compression fittings
What governs certification requirements for welding gas piping? A) Local codes only B) Boiler and Pressure Vessels Act C) Federal regulations D) Insurance requirements
What is the ASME BPVC? A) American Society of Mechanical Engineers Boiler and Pressure Vessel Code B) American Standard for Mechanical and Building Pressure Vessels Code C) Association of Safety and Mechanical Engineers Building Code D) American Safety for Mechanical Equipment Building Practices Code
What should not be confused with pressure vessel welding codes? A) CSA W59 Welded steel construction B) ASME stan

Piping Systems
Chapter 1 
Code Requirements and 
Approved Joining Methods
The installation of gas piping and tubing is a basic part of a gas 
technician's/fitter's duties. As a student, you must be aware of the code 
requirements concerning approved types of piping and tubing, as well as 
applicable joining methods. Pipe sizes, locations, and pressures are all 
factors that you must consider before installing a piping or tubing 
system.
MK
by Mike Kapin
Created
Copywrite 2025
Learning Objectives
Describe Code 
Requirements
Understand the Code 
requirements for industrial 
and commercial 
applications
Describe Joining 
Methods
Learn the joining methods 
that may be used for gas 
piping and tubing systems
Apply Knowledge
Apply code requirements and joining methods in practical 
installation scenarios
Key Terminology
Term
Definition
Bonding
Permanent joining of metallic 
parts to form an electrically 
conductive path that ensures 
electrical continuity and the

Purging Practical
Learning Outcome:
Upon completion of this lab, you will understand the process, tools, and setup for purging a gas system.
Instructions:
You will be setting up a purge tool to one to the appliances in the lab. Confirm with the instructor which appliance you will be using.
Note: Each step must be signed off by the instructor before proceeding to the next question. Skipped sign offs will result in lost marks (5 per). Any damage to the systems components due to negligence or horseplay will result in a mark of zero for the practical.
